poem:
### The Cost of Politics

In the shadowed halls of power,  
a kachina dance unfolds—  
pink slips flutter like autumn leaves,  
each carrying a price.  
Whispers of "poor performance" drift,  
like fragile petitions on the wind.  
The tally grows monumental,  
an abacus of injustice, counting  
unwarranted farewells,  
ghosts of lost livelihoods echoing  
in the corridors of duty.
